contentrichtext.text: {{more footnotes|date=December 2010}} '''Vmobile''' was a [[Nigeria]]n [[mobile phone]] network provider with close to a million subscribers in 2004. The company was previously owned by [[Econet Wireless Nigeria]], but after a shareholder dispute was purchased (for a month) by Vodacom of South Africa. The Vodacom deal was short lived, and the operator soon thereafter began trading a VMobile Nigeria, owned by Vee Netoworks Limited. The name Vee was based on Vee from Vodacom, after Vodacom pulled out of the deal. Vodacom's South African staff was retained by the Nigerian Investors, to run the now called VMobile network. Willem Swart was appointed as CEO, with a number of previous Econet staff as directors. The company claimed that all investors were Nigeria-based. They included the state governments of [[Lagos]], [[Delta State, Nigeria|Delta]] and [[Akwa Ibom State|Akwa Ibom]]. On April 16, 2006, [[Celtel]] made a conditional offer for Vmobile and in May 2006, Vmobile was bought over by Celtel for US$1.005. billion after Celtel acquired a controlling stake of 65% in Vmobile During its time, Vmobile branded itself as the network for the Nigerian people, with the catch phrase being "its all about you".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.sl/drwebsite/publish/article_20052607.shtml |title=Celtel Sierra Leone buys Nigeriaâ€™s Vmobile |accessdate=2007-06-14 |author=Awareness Times |authorlink= |coauthors= |date=2006-05-31|work= |publisher= |pages= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= }}</ref> ==References== <references/> [http://www.worldreport-ind.com/nigeria/vmobile.htm Interview with Willem Swart]<br> [http://web.archive.org/web/20060109002819/http://www.vmobile-nigeria.com/ A blast from the past... when it was all about you] ==External links== *[http://www.celtel.com/en/index.html Celtel Company Website] *[http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=V-Mobile&action=edit&section=1 Usage Statistics (pdf)] [[Category:Telecommunications companies of Nigeria]] [[Category:Defunct mobile phone companies]] {{Nigeria-media-stub}} {{telecom-company-stub}} {{Nigeria-company-stub}}
